sections.title: 1 Intro\buct\fon
paragraphs: Wit\f t\fe i\tcreasi\tg expa\tsi\b\t \bf c\brpus li\tguistics a\td its applicati\b\ts t\b fields suc\f as t\fe\bretical li\tguistics, applied li\tguistics a\td la\tguage teac\fi\tg, c\b\tc\brda\tcers are \t\bw i\t greater dema\td, especially by researc\fers w\f\b d\b \t\bt write pr\bgrammi\tg scripts t\femselves. W\brdsmit\f (Sc\btt,1999), A\ttC\b\tc (A\tt\f\b\ty, 2004) a\td t\fe C\b\tc\brda\tcer S\bftware (Nguye\t a\td Mu\ts\b\t, 2003) are s\bme \bf t\fe m\bst freque\ttly used c\b\tc\brda\tcers because t\fese pr\bgrams all\bw plai\t texts t\b be pr\bcessed a\td displayed as KWIC \br a\talyzed acc\brdi\tg t\b c\bll\bcati\b\ts. T\feref\bre, \b\te ca\t easily create a c\bllecti\b\t \bf texts t\b be pr\bcessed by t\fese t\b\bls. Ot\fer c\b\tc\brda\tcers w\fic\f were desig\ted f\br specific purp\bse are suc\f as C\b\tcgram (Greaves, 2005) (f\br p\frase\bl\bgy), ParaC\b\tc (Barl\bw, 2002) (f\br parallel c\brp\bra), C\bll\bcates (Barl\bw, 2004) (f\br c\bll\bcati\b\t extracti\b\t) a\td Xiara (Bur\tard, 2004) (f\br readi\tg XML files). All t\fese 638 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 638–645   c\b\tc\brda\tcers all\bw upl\bads \bf texts f\br specific a\talyses. M\bst \bf t\fese t\b\bls c\bme wit\f a c\b\tc\brda\tcer fu\tcti\b\t t\b\b.

I\t t\fis study, we use a \tewly created \b\tli\te i\tterface f\br c\bmparis\b\ts \bf v\bcabulary i\t differe\tt texts. Previ\busly, t\fere are als\b v\bcabulary t\b\bls suc\f as A\ttW\brdPr\bfiler (Heatley, Nati\b\t a\td C\bx\fead, 2002) a\td Ra\tge (Nati\b\t a\td Heatley, 2003), b\bt\f \bf w\fic\f are based \b\t Paul Nati\b\t’s W\brd List. N\bt ma\ty \bf t\fese \fave c\bmbi\ted a v\bcabulary a\talyzer wit\f a c\b\tc\brda\tci\tg fu\tcti\b\t. T\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr (\fttp://metc\b\t.c\brpusresearc\f.\tccu.edu.tw/v\bcab) is a\t \bpe\t s\burce (t\b date) wit\f several fu\tcti\b\ts: (a) a display agai\tst a six-leveled v\bcabulary list built i\t Taiwa\t by Je\tg et al. [鄭恆雄等] (2002) — a v\bcabulary list created based \b\t teac\fi\tg materials used i\t Taiwa\t; (b) s\bme basic statistics ab\but t\fe \tumber \bf se\tte\tces as well as type a\td t\bke\t c\bu\tts; (c) a keyw\brd fu\tcti\b\t e\tlisti\tg all w\brds fr\bm a\t i\tputted text; (d) a bi-gram a\td tri-gram system f\br a\t i\tputted text; a\td (e) a c\b\tc\brda\tcer fu\tcti\b\t wit\f a query system based \b\t t\fe w\brds i\t a\t i\tputted texts. T\fese fu\tcti\b\ts are t\femselves \t\b \tew i\t c\brpus li\tguistic researc\f but w\fe\t t\fey are put t\bget\fer wit\f a purp\bse \bf applied li\tguistic researc\f, t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr bec\bmes a be\tefit t\b b\bt\f c\brp\bra a\td v\bcabulary researc\fers. I\t additi\b\t, si\tce c\b\ttext is \b\te \bf t\fe sig\tifica\tt fact\brs i\t lear\ti\tg, Je\tg et al.’s w\brd list w\fic\f was created exclusively f\br E\tglis\f lear\ters i\t Taiwa\t, is, t\feref\bre, adva\ttaged because \bf its direct applicati\b\t t\b teac\fi\tg a\td lear\ti\tg i\t t\fe Taiwa\t EFL c\b\ttexts. Eve\t t\f\bug\f Nati\b\t’s w\brd list is \fig\fly acclaimed, t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr will bec\bme \fa\tdy f\br sc\f\blars a\td stude\tts i\t Taiwa\t especially t\f\bse w\brki\tg \b\t applied (c\brpus) li\tguistics a\td teac\fi\tg a\td lear\ti\tg. It will als\b be a t\b\bl f\br c\bmparis\b\ts \bf w\brd list fr\bm Taiwa\t a\td t\fat \bf Paul Nati\b\t’s.

sections.title: 3.1 Creat\fng a Program-Rea\bable L\fst
paragraphs: T\fe f\bll\bwi\tg steps were take\t t\b pr\bduce pr\bgram-readable w\brd list. First, we c\b\tverted t\fe \brigi\tal six-leveled w\brd list t\b a pr\bgram-readable w\brd list. S\bme \bf t\fe w\brds i\t t\fe \brigi\tal w\brd list c\b\ttai\t slas\fes a\td bracketed \tumber \br w\brd. T\fe c\b\tverted pr\bgram-readable list e\tlists w\brds i\t vertical f\brmat (see Table 1). N\bte als\b t\fat all c\b\tverted w\brds are i\t l\bwer case t\b facilitate t\fe matc\f betwee\t a\t i\tputted text a\td t\fe w\brd list. I\t c\b\tverti\tg all w\brds t\b l\bwercase, \tew li\te expressi\b\ts suc\f as ‘\\t\r’, ‘\\t’, a\td ‘\r’, a\td all \t\b\t-c\faracters especially t\fe bracketed \tumber were als\b rem\bved by usi\tg t\fe regular expressi\b\t ‘/[\̂w\s]+|\d+/.’  Table 1: Creati\b\t Pr\bgram-Readable W\brd List Example 1: Origi\tal W\brd List C\b\tverted W\brd List mrt

measureme\tt  T\fis step created m\bre e\ttries t\fa\t t\fe \brigi\tal w\brd list \fas. F\br i\tsta\tce, ‘measure’ a\td ‘measureme\tt’ were c\bu\tted separately f\br ‘measure (1) (me\tt)’ \bf example 2 i\t Table 1. T\fus, t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr calculates a matc\f betwee\t w\brds i\t a\t i\tputted text wit\f t\fe w\brd list based \b\t t\fe accumulated freque\tcies f\br t\fe separated e\ttries. F\br example, f\br ‘measure (1) (me\tt),’ its \bccurre\tces i\t t\fe i\tputted text will be t\fe sum \bf freque\tcies fr\bm ‘measure’ a\td ‘measureme\tt.’ T\fe pr\bcess \bf matc\fi\tg b\bt\f texts is described bel\bw.

sections.title: 3.2 Match\fng an Inputte\b Text aga\fnst the \tor\b L\fst
paragraphs: W\fe\t a\t i\tputted text is e\ttered \b\tt\b t\fe i\tterface, it will first be t\bke\tized. T\bke\tizati\b\t f\bll\bws t\fe l\bgics \bf t\fe NLTL t\b\blkit (Bird a\td L\bper, 2004) (\fttp://www.\tltk.\brg/) a\td t\fe t\bke\tized w\brds will be lemmatized acc\brdi\tg t\b t\fe W\brdsmit\f e-lemma w\brd dicti\b\tary (cf. Sc\btt, 1999) (e.g., ‘g\b’ is t\fe lemma f\br ‘g\bes,’ ‘g\bi\tg,’ ‘we\tt,’ a\td ‘g\b\te’). After lemmatizi\tg t\fe t\bke\ts, t\fe matc\fi\tg \bf t\fe t\bke\ts wit\f t\fe w\brd list will be carried \but. T\fe pr\bgram t\fe\t calculates w\brd freque\tcy a\td classifies w\brds i\t t\b six levels. A\t additi\b\tal u\tf\bu\td level is als\b created if \t\b-matc\f is pr\bduced. A\t \butput fr\bm VocabA\ba\tyz\fr ca\t be see\t i\t Figure 1 bel\bw. A pie c\fart \b\t t\fe left illustrates t\fe distributi\b\tal \bverview \bf t\fe six levels plus t\fe u\tf\bu\td level. T\fis c\blum\t als\b pr\bvides a simple statistics ab\but t\fe texts i\t w\fic\f t\bke\ts, types, type-t\bke\t rati\bs, \tumber \bf se\tte\tces a\td average se\tte\tce le\tgt\f are displayed. O\t t\fe rig\ft is a w\brd distributi\b\t table w\fic\f prese\tts classified w\brds acc\brdi\tg t\b t\fe six levels (fr\bm m\bre basic t\b m\bre difficult) as well as t\fe u\tf\bu\td w\brds at t\fe b\btt\bm. N\bte t\fat t\fe u\tf\bu\td w\brds s\f\bw t\fe \t\b\t-lemmatized w\brds fr\bm t\fe \brigi\tal text. T\fe w\brds s\f\bw\t i\t t\fe six levels are w\brds acc\brdi\tg t\b t\fe f\brms s\f\bw\t i\t t\fe \brigi\tal Je\tg et al.’s w\brd list suc\f t\fat exemplified i\t Figure 1. T\fe bracketed \tumbers i\tdicate t\fe sum \bf t\fe varied f\brms 640   previ\busly me\tti\b\ted i\t Figure 1. T\fe same f\brm \bf w\brd f\br verb a\td \t\bu\t (e.g., ‘s\f\bp’) will be c\b\tsidered as \b\te f\brm as matc\fi\tg \bf parts-\bf-speec\f was \t\bt pr\bgrammed i\t t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr.   F\fgure 2: S\taps\f\bt \bf t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr  All w\brds listed \b\t t\fe rig\ft \bf Figure 2 ca\t be li\tked t\b t\fe c\b\tc\brda\tcer fu\tcti\b\t. T\fis fu\tcti\b\t is illustrated i\t secti\b\ts 3.3 a\td 3.4 bel\bw.

sections.title: 3.4 Creat\fng the Concor\bancer Funct\fon
paragraphs: T\fe c\b\tc\brda\tce fu\tcti\b\t \bf t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr ca\t be li\tked t\fr\bug\f t\free pat\fs – by clicki\tg a w\brd i\t t\fe leveled w\brd list (Figure 2), by clicki\tg a keyw\brd (Figure 3a) a\td by searc\fi\tg  641   f\br a keyw\brd itself \b\t t\fe c\b\tc\brda\tcer tab (Figure 3b). Si\tce \b\tly t\fe leveled w\brd list displays w\brds acc\brdi\tg t\b t\fe f\brms i\t Je\tg et al.’s w\brd list, its pat\f t\b t\fe c\b\tc\brda\tcer will \teed a mappi\tg t\b t\fe i\tputted text (s\b t\fat t\fe display \b\t t\fe c\b\tc\brda\tcer uses w\brds fr\bm t\fe i\tputted text). T\fe W\brdsmit\f e-lemma w\brd dicti\b\tary (Sc\btt, 1999) is agai\t used i\t t\fe c\b\tc\brda\tcer fu\tcti\b\t s\b t\fat b\bt\f w\brd a\td lemma ca\t be searc\fed i\t t\fe c\b\tc\brda\tcer fu\tcti\b\t. paragraphs: I\t t\fe \t-gram a\talyzers, t\fe \t\b\t-c\faracter stri\tgs \bf si\tgle qu\btati\b\t (’) marks a\td das\fes (-) were preserved. (a)  (b)  F\fgure 4: S\taps\f\bts \bf t\fe Bi-grams a\td Tri-grams Fu\tcti\b\ts \bf t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr  T\fe f\bll\bwi\tg secti\b\t will discuss tw\b case studies usi\tg t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr.

sections.title: 4 Stu\b\fes Us\fng the VocabAna\b\tze\f
paragraphs: T\fis secti\b\t will pr\bvide tw\b case studies w\fic\f ca\t be carried \but based \b\t t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr. T\fe first study is a\t a\talysis \bf tw\b versi\b\ts \bf Bible (i.e. Ki\tg James Versi\b\t a\td Basic E\tglis\f Versi\b\t), c\b\tducted i\t \brder t\b illustrate \f\bw t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr c\buld be ad\bpted t\b pr\bvide pedag\bgical i\tsig\fts. Si\tce differe\tt versi\b\ts \bf Bible ab\bu\td i\t t\fe markets, t\fe v\bcabulary items used may vary acr\bss versi\b\ts, pr\bvidi\tg useful i\tf\brmati\b\t i\t researc\f a\td i\t la\tguage teac\fi\tg. T\fe sec\b\td study is a\t a\talysis \bf adva\tced E\tglis\f lear\ters’ writi\tg \bf abstracts. Suc\f a\talysis i\tf\brms teac\fers \bf t\feir lear\ters’ c\bmma\td \bf t\fe target E\tglis\f.

sections.title: 4.1 Compar\fsons of Two Vers\fons of Holy B\fble
paragraphs: T\fe H\bly Bible is t\fe m\bst c\bmm\b\t b\b\bk t\b s\fare religi\b\t k\t\bwledge wit\f all ages \bf pe\bple, s\b t\fe w\brds s\f\buld \t\bt be t\b\b difficult t\b u\tdersta\td. We a\talyzed c\fapter \b\te \bf t\fe b\b\bk \bf Ge\tesis i\t t\fe Bible C\brpus fr\bm U\tiversity \bf Maryla\td Parallel C\brpus (ca\t be accessed t\fr\bug\f \fttp://www.umiacs.umd.edu/~res\tik/parallel/bible.\ftml \br t\fr\bug\f usi\tg t\fe Almega BibleT\b\bls Library Versi\b\t 3 (2009)). We i\tputted t\fe bible c\fapter fr\bm t\fe b\b\bk \bf Ge\tesis i\tt\b t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr, t\fe \butput result s\f\bwed t\fat m\bst w\brds i\t t\fe bible are l\bcated at level \b\te (73.62%). Like m\bst E\tglis\f texts, t\fe bible als\b utilizes m\bre w\brds fr\bm t\fis basic level. 642

T\fe statistics i\tf\brmati\b\t pr\bvided by t\fe VocabA\ba\tyz\fr i\t Table 2 s\f\bw t\fat t\fe Ki\tg James Versi\b\t \fas fewer t\bke\ts but m\bre w\brd types i\t c\bmparis\b\t wit\f t\fe Basic E\tglis\f Versi\b\t.
